questions.question: The measurement of surface temperature is made:
options: a. at ground level
b. at approximately 10 metres from ground level
c. at approximately 4 feet above ground level
d. at approximately 4 metres above ground level

questions.question: The purpose of a "Stevenson screen" is to:
options: a. maintain a moist atmosphere so that the wet bulb thermometer can function correctly
b. prevent the mercury freezing in the low winter temperatures
c. protect the thermometer from wind, weather and from direct sunshine
d. keep the wet and dry bulb thermometers away from surface extremes of temperature

questions.question: If temperature remains constant with an increase in altitude there is:
options: a. an inversion
b. an inversion aloft
c. uniform lapse rate
d. an isothermal layer

questions.question: The surface of the earth is heated by:
options: a. convection
b. conduction
c. long wave solar radiation
d. short wave solar radiation

questions.question: Cloud cover will reduce diurnal variation of temperature because:
options: a. incoming solar radiation is reflected back to space and outgoing terrestrial radiation is reflected back to earth
b. incoming solar radiation is re-radiated back to space and atmospheric heating by convection will stop at the level of the cloud layer
c. the cloud stops the sun's rays getting through to the earth and also reduces outgoing conduction
d. incoming solar radiation is reflected back to space and outgoing terrestrial radiation is re-radiated from the cloud layer back to the surface

questions.question: Diurnal variation of the surface temperature will:
options: a. be unaffected by a change of wind speed
b. decrease as wind speed increases
c. increase as wind speed increases
d. be at a minimum in calm conditions

questions.question: Which of the following surfaces is likely to produce a higher than average diurnal variation of temperature:
options: a. rock or concrete
b. water
c. snow
d. vegetation

questions.question: Most accurate temperatures above ground level are obtained by:
options: a. tephigram
b. aircraft reports
c. temperature probe
d. radiosonde

questions.question: The method by which energy is transferred from one body to another by contact is called:
options: a. radiation
b. convection
c. conduction
d. latent heat

questions.question: The diurnal variation of temperature is:
options: a. greater over the sea than overland
b. less over desert areas then over temperate grassland
c. reduced anywhere by the presence of cloud
d. increased anywhere as wind speed increases

questions.question: The troposphere is heated largely by:
options: a. absorption of the sun's short wave radiation
b. radiation of heat from cloud tops and the earth's surface
c. absorption by ozone of the sun's short wave radiation
d. conduction from the surface, convection and the release of latent heat

questions.question: An inversion is one in which:
options: a. there is no horizontal gradient of temperature
b. there is no change of temperature with height
c. there is an increase of temperature as height increases
d. there is a decrease of temperature as height increases

questions.question: The sun gives out ______ amount of energy with ______ wavelengths. The earth gives out relatively ______ amounts of energy with relatively ______ wavelengths:
options: a. large, large, small, small
b. small, small, large, large
c. large, large, small, large
d. large, small, small, large

questions.question: With a clear night sky, the temperature change with height by early morning is most likely to show:
options: a. a steady lapse rate averaging $2^{\circ}C$ per 1000 ft
b. a stable lapse rate of $1^{\circ}C$ per 1000 ft
c. an inversion above the surface with an isothermal layer above
d. an inversion from near the surface and a $2^{\circ}C$ per 1000 ft lapse rate above

questions.question: Over continents and oceans, the relative temperature conditions are:
options: a. warmer in winter over land, colder in summer over sea
b. colder in winter over land, warmer in winter over sea
c. cold in winter over land and sea
d. warmer in summer over land and sea
